required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Collecting and Storing Blood and Tumor Tissue Samples From Patients Undergoing Prostatectomy or Transurethral Resection of the Prostate
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Tumor Resistance and Stem Cells in Prostate Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

collaborator.agency: Rutgers Cancer Institute of New Jersey

clinical_study.source: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to collect material for study's to assess mechanisms of tumor progression, mechanisms of resistance, isolation of stem cells and biologic markers in tissue, serum and peripheral blood mononuclear cells.

primary_outcome.measure: Collection and freezing of tumor samples

biospec_descr.textblock: Samples will be collected at time of TURP and will be deidentified and processed by standard procedures.

study_pop.textblock: Any patient undergoing a routine prostatectomy or TURP (transurethral resection of the prostate) may be asked to participate

criteria.textblock:
DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS:
- Undergoing routine prostatectomy or transurethral resection of the prostate (TURP)
PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS:
5.1.1 Patient is undergoing routine prostatectomy or TURP.
5.1.2 Patient is â‰¥ 18 years old.
5.1.3 Patient must give informed consent.
PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY:
